Class DriverExam

java.lang.Object
  DriverExam

public class DriverExam
extends java.lang.Object

Class describing a driver's exam which takes input from a driver and compares the answers to a key and displays whether the driver has passed or failed.

Version:
v1.0 Nov 8th, 2016
Author:
Vinay Punwani

Method Summary
 java.lang.Boolean checkValidInputs(java.lang.String answer)
          Method checkValidInputs which compares each answer input from the driver against a list of valid answers, returning true if the answer is valid and false if not valid.
 int getTotalCorrectAnswers()
          Method getTotalCorrectAnswers which calls a private method to enumerate all the correct answers provided by the driver
 int getTotalIncorrectAnswers()
          Method getTotalIncorrectAnswers which calls a private method to enumerate all the correct answers provided by the driver, then returns the difference between that number and the total number of questions
static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
          Method main which creates a DriverExam object, then asks for student answers to be validated, then displays whether the student has passed or failed.
 java.lang.Boolean passOrFail()
          Method passOrFail which compares the total number of correct answers with the passing grade and displays a message based on the result
 void promptStudentAnswers()
          Method promptStudentAnswers which prompts the user for answers to twenty questions of the exam and ensures the responses are valid answers, then saves them to a new driver responses array if they are valid.

Constructor Detail

DriverExam

public DriverExam()
Default Constructor for objects of class DriverExam

Method Detail

checkValidInputs

public java.lang.Boolean checkValidInputs(java.lang.String answer)
Method checkValidInputs which compares each answer input from the driver against a list of valid answers, returning true if the answer is valid and false if not valid.

Parameters:
answer - A parameter which contains the response of the driver for each question
Returns:
The return value which is true if the response is valid and false if not

getTotalCorrectAnswers

public int getTotalCorrectAnswers()
Method getTotalCorrectAnswers which calls a private method to enumerate all the correct answers provided by the driver

Returns:
The return value which is the number of correct answers

getTotalIncorrectAnswers

public int getTotalIncorrectAnswers()
Method getTotalIncorrectAnswers which calls a private method to enumerate all the correct answers provided by the driver, then returns the difference between that number and the total number of questions

Returns:
The return value which is the number of correct answers subtracted from the total number of questions.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Method main which creates a DriverExam object, then asks for student answers to be validated, then displays whether the student has passed or failed.

Parameters:
args - A parameter representing arguments passed to the main method

passOrFail

public java.lang.Boolean passOrFail()
Method passOrFail which compares the total number of correct answers with the passing grade and displays a message based on the result

Returns:
The return value which indicates whether the driver has passed the exam or not

promptStudentAnswers

public void promptStudentAnswers()
Method promptStudentAnswers which prompts the user for answers to twenty questions of the exam and ensures the responses are valid answers, then saves them to a new driver responses array if they are valid. Then displays the results of the exam.
